The AI node currently doesn’t support AWS Assume Role credentials, unlike Lambda and other nodes. This makes it hard to use in production since STS tokens expire every few hours. Adding Assume Role support would allow workflows to run securely without manual credential updates.

hey you might want to try using a Linux VM on your Mac to download the AMD64 images. Since the VM runs an actual x86_64 environment, Docker won’t try to pull ARM images or fall back to emulation. You can simply pull the correct amd64 n8n image inside the VM, export it with docker save, and then transfer it to your server. This avoids the architecture mismatch issues you're running into on macOS ARM.

i try to call gitlab crm contacts that are handled with graphql api, it gives the first 100 but then i cant seem to get past that.

The reason the API stops at 100 contacts is because GitLab uses Relay-style cursor pagination. Each response includes pageInfo.endCursor, and that value must be sent into the next GraphQL request as after:. Without re-sending that cursor, the API always returns the first page. Implementing a loop that checks hasNextPage and updates the cursor solves the issue.

Headless means when you activate it doesn't consume memory for the UI. So if you see some spike in when you build a workflow it's absolutely fine. For me it takes about 3 GB memory when I am building that workflow of about 45 nodes but after I turned the Active switch on the workflow takes less as it was just the UI taking up memory at a moment.
